Barth : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now
Remira : Try to open the gate by hand / let go the grip and step back / Turn around by impact / See where the threat is now

PleaAtTheGate.text:
CinematicNodeContext: A13 - Worg : Hungry / start advancing
Goblins : Screaming / Charging / passing by the Worg and the cameras (for some)NodeContext: Hungry for human flesh
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: A13 - Worg : Hungry / start advancing
Goblins : Screaming / Charging / passing by the Worg and the cameras (for some)NodeContext: Hungry for human flesh

PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Aradin
PleaAtTheGate.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barth : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Aradin : From his position on his last shot, he get into his fighting stance
Remira : From her position on her last shot, she get into her fighting stance

AD_WyllCharge.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

Adventurer1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

AdventurerLeader.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader.text: Out of my way. I'll tear the horns off that bloody coward!
AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Furious at Zevlor, who nearly locked him out of the grove.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Said it from the start. Shouldn't have trusted those foulbloods.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: Very nasty. All-but-saying a slur re: tieflings

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.text: Scouts - get to the high ground. Raiders - charge the bastards!
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: Shouting commands to his troops as they enter combat

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: A warcry to his new god, the Absolute

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.text: The danger has passed - for now. Open the gates.
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a high pointl

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Open up or I'll break the bloody thing down!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Look - please, just let us in. They're almost on us.
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.context: NodeContext: Still angry but trying to be reasonable.

VB_ApproachingGate.speaker: Player
VB_ApproachingGate.text: We should check it out - but be careful.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

AD_WyllWantsOut.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllWantsOut.text: Bastards. The Blade comes for you.
AD_WyllWantsOut.context: NodeContext: This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.text: That was the last of them. Inside - all of you. More may follow.
OpenGate.context: NodeContext: Shouted down to us - at the bottom of the gate

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Zevlor calls for gate to open (custom camera)NodeContext: Calling out o someone standing on his level, but not extremely close.

AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderRant.context: NodeContext: If Zevlor is dead, Aradin sees his corpse

AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation.text: One less demon to worry about.

AD_TieflingWakesUp.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingWakesUp.context: NodeContext: Aradin just punched him in the face. This is him waking up after getting knocked out.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.AD_WyllWantsOut: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.OpenGate: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderRant: Complaint the adventurer leader says after the goblins have been dealt with, before returning to the Den after the gates are opened.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation: AD the adventurer leader says just before running into the Den to confront the tiefling leader.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingWakesUp: Player when the tiefling leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.

AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Calling out to someone she has seen but not met. Friendly and inviting.

VB_HagLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_HagLeaves.text: That old woman was certainly memorable.
VB_HagLeaves.context: NodeContext: Positive but unsure. She was charming but also strange.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: This is the hag calling out to a player she doesn't know. The player is a distance from her, and she is cheerily waving a hello.
session_synopses.VB_HagLeaves: VB played when the player sees the Hag leave the Den.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey, you're back. Here to trade?

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Only going to ask you one more time, boy. Hand over my locket.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: I don't have your ugly locket. I've never even seen it before!

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Hand it over or I'll slap the teeth out of your head.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Don't you dare lay a finger on that child.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Forget it. I don't want any trouble.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: And I thought he was a coward.
CinematicNodeContext: |*The adventurer stares down at the defiant child, wavering, fists clenching*|
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: |*The adventurer stares down at the defiant child, wavering, fists clenching*|

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Barth strikes the child Meli. The child cries out in pain.|

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: Feel better? Or were you hoping I'd cry?
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: In pain, defiantNodeContext: In pain, defiant

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: You like watching people hit kids? You happy now?
RobbedAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kid turns to the player, angry.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Throat if you can. Wrist if you can't.

AD_KidGuardReport.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.RobbedAdventurer:
Non-critpath. A human adventurer accuses a tiefling child of stealing a necklace from him. A tiefling guard may intervene if things get out of hand. 

Barth: Angry, but gruff and restrained. 
Meli: Fearless, urging Barth on.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We don't even know these people!
AD.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses.Brother: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.

AD_LookingForInstrument.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: What's that tune you're singing?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Are you all right?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
False

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Get the hells away from me.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.NodeContext: Angry.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: Don't mock her - she's trying her best... I assume.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Oh no! Whatever shall we do?
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: My head is melting! I'm leaving before the damage is permanent.
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

AD_StartingOver.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_InstrumentStolen.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentStolen.text: Get away from me. I mean it!
AD_InstrumentStolen.context: NodeContext: Player has stolen her dead teacher's instrument. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

session_synopses.AD_LookingForInstrument: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.
session_synopses.Bard:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.
session_synopses.AD_StartingOver: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.
session_synopses.AD_InstrumentStolen: The bard is sitting. Snaps at the player.
session_synopses.AD_Dejected: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Would that we could speak freely, my ursine friend!
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Alas, I've never learned to converse with your kind.
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Pardon me! Must prepare to travel - good day, my friend!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cheerfully done with you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are you heading?

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: ...I'll tell you, if you'd be so good as to answer a few questions pertaining to the goblins you encountered at the gates.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to entice the player.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: A few questions, if you please. There's no overstating my interest.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He wants to write down what you'll say. Enthusiastic.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine - ask your questions.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Glory! Now, then:
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's ready to write, quill to book.NodeContext: Player agreed to answer his questions. He's happy but also arrogant, like a rich old person saying 'you're an absolute DOLL' when you do a minor favor for them.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: How would you describe that particular batch of goblins? Size? Nature? Distinguishing qualities?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Quizzing the player, looking for info for his book. He's more professional here, curious.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You search your mind, successfully recalling various details of goblin behaviour.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Common variety goblins, led by a lasher and flanked by booyahgs.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: My! A scholar after my own heart. Spent much time among goblins?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The time was spent among books. I'm a student of the page.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Aha! I've always preferred experience to the second-hand accounts of lesser men. But to each their own!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Now I've a few more questions, if you don't mind.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: And the... dragon they had marching in the rear. Was it of the brass or silver variety?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Volo is bullshitting. There was no dragon and he knows it. But he's stating it to the player as though he believes it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Dragon...? There wasn't any dragon.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: 'Witnesses... failed... to... notice the... obvious... dragon...'
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Response to 'I told him there was no dragon.' Volo's sensationalizing again.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Last question, then you'll be quite free. Did the attackers rally to 'the Absolute' when they fell upon the gates?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's wrapping things up, in full journalism mode.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't think so. I was concentrating on not dying.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Really? Well, this does complicate things... but then again... well, never mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player says goblins didn't invoke 'the Absolute.' Volo is turning the idea around in his head, trying to figure it out. A man in thought.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: I've interrogated one - a captive in this very camp. She reports they've abandoned their god Maglubiyet in favour of someone called 'the Absolute'.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: The scandal!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hissed like he's just conveyed a very juicy bit of gossip

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hold your tongue.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Never you mind. I'm on my way to their camp as we speak. I always knew my studies in Ghukliak would come to some use.

session_synopses.AD: Volo will have some casual behavior around camp. One of these behaviors is to wander over to a druid's tame bear and try to talk to it.
session_synopses: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Gan
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill so many goblins.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Challenging - "You can't be doing more than me!"

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee3Responses.text: I'm going to kill six hundred.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.

VB_UnlockedStudy.speaker: Player
VB_UnlockedStudy.text: Well well, what have we here.

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text: *The mural shows druids claiming the grove in the name of the Old Oak - Silvanus, god of nature.*

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.VB_UnlockedStudy: |You retrieved the missing wolf rune, placed it back in the socket, clicked on the 4 runes and now the wolf statue is sinking down in the ground, revealing spiral stairs.|
session_synopses.FrescoFoundingGrove: Player is examining a mural on the wall of the Druid's Grove, depicting its foundation.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: You have good timing. Never been much of a fighter, so wrestling a bugbear would have gone poorly.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: But you're not here for heroics, are you? Avernus' stench is all over your skin.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Let me guess: your devil mistress sent you to get her soul coin back. Too bad. I earned it fair and square.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Oh man, a soul coin? Wouldn't mind getting my hands on that...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very interested but maybe downplaying her interest.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That bugbear would have crushed your skull. This is the thanks I get?

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Why thank you, dread slayer of bugbears. You shall live forever in my memory.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dramatically exaggerated/sarcastic.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Now take my regards back to that pouting erinyes and leave me alone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very flat, almost cold.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How about this? You give me the coin. Now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You hand the coin over, or I kill you. How about that?
True

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Considering you turned that bugbear into paste...

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: ...that's a good trade. Except the coin seems to have slipped through a hole in my pocket somewhere. Damn it.

session_synopses: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Indifferent. If your power is truly yours it will return to you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *With or without your powers you're at ease. Magic cannot be tamed - not even by you.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: Beldron said we'll head back to the city. But the others at Moonrise...

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: ... I can't bear to think of it.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Laridda reflects on her missing friends, who are trapped in Moonrise.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Try to focus. What more can you see?

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The harder you look, the fuzzier the images become, until there is only grey.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Image blurs before greying out/fading to black

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.
CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: I am a True Soul. You will treat me with honour.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want in? Pay the toll.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: I call it the True Soul special.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.NodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Fine - take this. Consider it a goodwill gesture. |XXX gold|

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Now go on, sergeant's above. Can't miss her - just follow the screams.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

Saved.speaker: Skickpit
Saved.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

session_synopses.Saved: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grab the sword with both hands and pull.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *No matter how you grip or tug, the sword remains firmly lodged in the stone.*

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted.speaker: Astarion
Looted.text: Don't waste your time hoping. It's probably long dead.

Looted.speaker: Astarion
Looted.text: Of course, being dead doesn't stop everyone in their tracks. But hopefully it's somewhere quiet, decaying peacefully.

session_synopses.Looted: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

001.speaker: Ward Magmar
001.text: Shove off. Just 'cause you offed Nere doesn't mean I'm sharing.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*the Circle is cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

session_synopses.CINE_PowerCutscene: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The rock under your feet juts upwards, forming a perfectly engraved tombstone with a small epitaph.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is a duplicate of node N15

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text:
*In memory of Myrna - a shining light in this dark world.
May you forever gaze upon the lake you loved to play in.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Dig into the dirt with your hands.
CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*

session_synopses: Tombstone on the grave at Sussur Tree. Digging the grave unveils a collar of a pet (cat or dog). The pet was of cleric of Mystra who lived in the Arcane Tower nearby. This collar has no use on the first sight, at least there's no magical properties. But the secret is it allowed cleric's pet to have food or navigate inside the tower.

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Player
Hermit_Dead.text: If you wish to see your beloved in the afterlife, I can smooth the way.

session_synopses.Hermit_Dead: Filro is one of three drow rivalry wizards in the Underdark who was looking for the Adamantine Forge, but his long research, loneliness and effects of the Sussur Tree  turned him mad. He lives with the hook horrors pack now.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Player
Rothe_001.text: Give in to your rage and avenge your pain. Don't strike us all, just your masters.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: Yes. They made the pain. Now they feel it!
Rothe_001.context: NodeContext: She's been egged on by the player to attack her duergar handlers.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Nicely handled. Those rothé old sweethearts of yours or something?
Guard_002.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Pity I got to split you - that forge ain't for sharing.

Guard_002.speaker: Player
Guard_002.text: I calmed the rothé, and now you want me dead?

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: You think we're letting you near that forge? You're as dumb as you are stupid.

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002.speaker: Player
Rothe_002.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: Fantastic work. You're a right master of beasts.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: But ain't no one but clan need to be using the forge back there - and we can't have you blabbing!

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: What in the hells? What's this all about?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

session_synopses.Rothe_001: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
session_synopses.Guard_002: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).
session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Pull Nere from the rubble. Time Nere gets what's coming.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave the True Soul to me. Now tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Lunkbug, don't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do what I can.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: I'll have no part of this.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*it is my right. it is my right!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign.text: *Its delicate harmonies turn to scrapes and scratches.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
InjuredGnome.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

InjuredGnome.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome.text: What will you do when you return?

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I greet you, child of the sun. How has your search for the mushrooms fared?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Best way to deal with that sort of hunger, I suppose.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps the peoples of the Underdark will be less inclined to violence if they comprehend the cost, yes?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Nere's dead body.

NereHeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
NereHeadLoot.text: *The head breaks off cleanly from the drow's body.*
NereHeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show player's face as they finish decapitation, stow knife. Raise head to inspect it.

session_synopses.NereHeadLoot: After the drow Nere dies, the players have the option to cut off his head if they are on a Myconid Revenge quest. If they fail the Strength check, the player makes a mess of it and the party gets splattered.

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.
node_data.context:
NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

Clan-sen means a duergar from another clan. Pronounced like it is spelled.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard.

session_synopses.CINE_FromPLA: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using an elevator to get from the Zhentarim Hideout to the Underdark

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: Godsdamned dwarf. What are you doing on Gekh's raft?

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
