RaftEvent.text: Duergar, like you? Saw his body a way back. Myconids got him.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What a load of rothé shite. No way a mushroom killed Gekh.

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still feeling the effects from having been petrified

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: Wizard Dhourn hired us... find a... forge.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: Came across Xargrim... his friend - a fight broke out. He summoned a spectator. Fool.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: He escaped. His spectator petrified us... somehow.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.text: *You heard its like described before - a memory shard, used to store brief mental impressions from the user's mind.*

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.005: This drow was petrified by a spectator. And will still feel a bit sick when he's woken up. Disoriented somewhat.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.
session_synopses.MemoryCrystal: This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn).The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Where did the drow come from?

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Caught 'em sniffin' around. Easy marks - had the stench of the top-lands.

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Hung them here as a warning. Ain't no one drughs with Clan Flameshade.
01.context: NodeContext: Drugh = DROOG. Like GOOD, not FOOD. Expletive = 'fucks'

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - “Duergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.”One duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us he’s keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *An object catches your eye - a lantern, it seems, though no light flickers within.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: | NEEDS CONTEXT |

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the lantern in more detail.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see no burner or wick. It was not fuel that lit this lamp, but magic.*

session_synopses: Player finds a broken Moonlantern while looting Nere's body. Companions reflect on it - either unsure what it is or discussing the fact that it's a Moonlantern, which would help them traverse a cursed land. If it wasn't broken.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: There's more back there. Get them out, please!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: I want Nere out - and it sounds like you have a lead.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: I ain't parleying with more Twat-Souls. And you got the stench.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Freeze it, cock-stench. We aren't done just yet.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Nere and his Absolute wanks owed us a wad of coin. And the dregs on his corpse aren't gonna cut it.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Pay up, and you get to slink away. Resist, and I gut you. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort.text: I don't have that kind of gold on me.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: That so? Then your head should do nicely. Zavagh!
RebelGreedyExtort.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.RebelGreedyExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Hurk
node_data.text: Been a long day for all of us, so don't try nothin' funny.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: How peculiar. Smooth face, cobbled edges. They're a sign - they must be.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason Kith facing away from player, looking at rubble.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: A sundweller in these parts? Look here, my top-side friend - I need fresh eyes. And I doubt I'll find fresher.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: The stonemason turns to you and addresses you directly.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: Peering into cracks and crevasses in hope to find history's morsels.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: I have come up regrettably short. I hope you might see truths where I cannot.

session_synopses.01: Duergar looking at stonework. Gruff sounding but surprisingly sophisticated. He asks you to examine the stonework and responds with his interpretation based on what you tell him

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

session_synopses.PAD_IdolLooted: Party loots the Idol of Shar.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is shouting at the gnomes.

session_synopses.AtPier_02: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The longer you stare, the more uneasy you feel. There is a presence. You are seen.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye more intensely

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Smile and wave.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The scrying eye doesn't blink.*

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

AD_FailedWisdomSave.text: A burden, mine blessing can also be. So sorry. Ho ho HO!

session_synopses.AD_FailedWisdomSave: After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability  if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

AD_BOOOALAppears.speaker: BOOOAL
AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.AD_BOOOALAppears: This line plays when we force a creature to reveal itself by overwhelming it with bloodlust
session_synopses.KuoToaMinion: A  node that plays when the player tries to click on a praying kuotoa. They will either praise you as the Chosen of their madeup god, or make you a new made-up god.BOOOAL - Booh-ALMahkloompah - mak-LOOM-pah
session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

PAD_NobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_NobleStalk.text: Strange... I remember a tiefling boy. Purple hair... Rennald. Who is that?
PAD_NobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Unsure. Relaying a strange memory fragment that's just been restored to her. Ren-awld

session_synopses.PAD_NobleStalk: Fallback in case the memory stalk dialog does not start. Cheap version of the memory.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Beldron - thank Ironhand!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Beldron

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We ought to thank someone a little closer by, I think.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Tired, wry - referencing the player when his husband thanks the gods

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Gaerdal Ironhand you may not be, but you damn well fight like him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impressed with you - someone thanked the war-god Ironhand and he's implying you're the next best thing

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I'm grateful, don't mistake me, but... why help us? You're one of them, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Guarded, sizing the player up - he thinks we're one of the cultists

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you always so suspicious of those who save you?

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: I try not to need saving. Hasn't much worked out, as you can see.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Self-deprecating

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: You did just lift a mountain from our heads, so... good enough for me, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nodding, accepting - not going to look a gift horse in the mouth

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Here - the Ironhand Gnomes honour their debts. With Wulbren gone, that falls to me.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard 'handing reward' animation.NodeContext: Drawing himself up to perform a necessary obligation - doesn't see himself as leadership material but accepts the responsibility

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Make it quick! We need to find Wulbren - now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep the coin. It seems like you'll need it.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: No. Debt's a stone 'round your neck, and we Ironhands like to walk tall. We'll be fine.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently firm - too proud not to give you a reward

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: It's Wulbren I'm worried for. He was sent on to Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We were just slave-hands to the cult, but not Wulbren. He... knows things. Things they want to know too.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant to say exactly what Wulbren knows

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What has he gotten himself mixed up in now...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Before you ask, no - I'm not going to stage a rescue.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Aye. Nor us, I'm afraid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: shrugging, a little defeated. This line trails off into another 'Much as I want to march after Wulbren myself... we can't.'

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: We have our own freedom to look to, I'm afraid. We'll take our chance when it arises, then back to the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: His people are still enslaved - he needs to be pragmatic.

node_data.speaker: Beldron
node_data.text: Wulbren knew the risks when he came in search of runepowder. We all did.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses: The gnome leader's main dialogue. He thanks you for saving them, and tells you what brought his people to the Underdark to begin with - an expedition led by their charismatic leader Wulbren, to find a forgotten gnomish explosive of awesome power - runepowder.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

Cultist002_Dead.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_Dead.text: Brynna... a faithful... servant to... the Absolute...

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.Cultist002_Dead: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, is dead. Here, the player casts a spell to grant limited and temporary resurrection for the purpose of questioning her. From her, they can learn more about the cult's hierarchy, specfically the meaning of the 'True Soul' rank that is frequently referred to. Her ability to communicate after death is limited - cryptic, broken or repetitive answers to a small range of questions. If she recognises her killer, she can refuse to answer or else lie.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.text: Hang on, Ed. You're going to be all right.
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: One of the cult acolytes vocalises what both of them are thinking: the comrade they're praying for looks on the verge of death.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The first acolyte clings to his faith. Easier than planning a contingency.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The second acolyte continues to press her point, uncertain of what comes next for them.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.text: You're all right, Ed. You're all right.
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The first acolyte loses his patience. Prayer is the best strategy he has for now - he wasn't expecting to have to call the shots.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.
session_synopses.AD_Cultists: A brother and sister are worried, trying to figure out how to help their older brother (True Soul) Edowin. He's quickly fading. They are lost and lone, but haven't lost faith in the Absolute.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.

Village_Trespassing.text: You sent from Moonrise, drow? 'Cos otherwise, I'll have to cut ya.

session_synopses.Village_Trespassing: This guard has come upon you sneaking through a village her force is occupying. She was bored and sees you as a potential source of fun (ie, someone to murder/bully).  Defaulting to she, but numerous goblins could deliver this dialogue as it's a dynamic crime one.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: What's this? Something weak, something tender...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing up the player.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sorry - wrong cave. I'll be going.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: I don't think so. You've seen my nest. You've seen my cub.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: That makes you dangerous. An easy meal.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: The meat tastes better when it's afraid.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just allow me to leave. I'm no threat to you or your cub.
False

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: You'll be even less of a threat when you're in pieces.

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.PAD_HealedOwlbear: A short VB after player heals the Owlbear in gameplay. Owlbear is still dangerous, though. This can happen either before or after the player has interacted with Owlbear. It's meant to give feedback on the fact that the owlbear is now healed, but not to encourage the player to provoke her.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_003.text: The worms'll feast on your sorry carcass when I'm done with you!

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

AD_ForgeWeapon.speaker: Player
AD_ForgeWeapon.text: There's still life left in this old thing.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.AD_ForgeWeapon: The player clicks on a forge. What they say depends on how much of the recipe they have collected. They can make a fancy weapon with the right ingredients.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You seem a little confused.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Yes. My reward - now.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: As expected. Coercion by the book.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a little far from home for a deep gnome.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Ignorance is alive and well, it seems! Deep gnomes aren't restricted to the Underdark, you know - I've lived in Baldur's Gate for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Testily

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. He had this locket, see, that I gave him years ago before leaving home.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in Baldur's Gate. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I always help my friends.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He says his goodbyes, turns and walks away

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.text: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes

SpeedUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.
SpeedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.SpeedUp: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.

PAD_SeluniteNecklace.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluniteNecklace.context: NodeContext: Upon seeing a Selunite necklace

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteNecklace: Reflection on the Selunite necklace found in the abandoned village.
session_synopses.AD_FoundJournal: The party finds a old diary in the ruined schoolhouse of an abandoned village. They comment that it might shed some light on what happened here.
session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: InternalNodeContext: Non-barbarian flowNodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Talk and you might live. If it's worth my while.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: M-my lot are camped nearby - I can get you inside, no hassle! You can loot it, do whatever!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: There's a hidden path, p-past the bridge into the camp. Over to the side before you reach the first guards. Easy.
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

StatusFallback.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback.text: What's this? Local wildlife havin' a gawk?
StatusFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here. Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player (in wildshape animal form)InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Cruel bravado + some surprise. Reacting to the player approaching while in animal form.

StatusFallback.speaker: Fezzerk
StatusFallback.text: Kill it - that thing'll roast up nicely for our supper.
StatusFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Waving on his fellow goblins to attack the player.InternalNodeContext: NOTE: Camera should avoid showing the player as they could be in an unknown wildshape form here.NodeContext: Urging his cronies to attack the player.

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

session_synopses.Surrender_NotAtWindmill: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.
session_synopses.StatusFallback: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to an windmill and are watching him spin around. Here, the player approaches while using wildshape (they're in animal form, so the scene unfolds in a shortened manner that quickly turns to combat).
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You yank the dagger free, leaving a narrow slit behind.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_InspectCookingPot.speaker: Player
VB_InspectCookingPot.text: Reeks of mugwort. Tastes terrible, but makes some useful potions.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_InspectCookingPot: The player examines a large pot in an abandoned house. They may or may not realise it was used for brewing potions, not cooking,
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

Goblin_02.speaker: Brawler Brek
Goblin_02.text: Hey... boss. Lots of your sort around these days.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_Boss.text: Gotta be somethin' in this heap.
AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

session_synopses.Goblin_02: This goblin is leading a band of looters in an abandoned house. They're too distracted by greed to fight, but if the player persists they'll attack.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you approach, a guttural scream and a succession of quick bangs rattle the door.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then a low moan. Someone - or something - is having a bit of fun.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the couple.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses.AD_OgreKilled: The players have killed the ogress (the bugbear's lover) and he swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_Combat_Goblins_Caster_01.text: Gonna add your ears to my collection once you're dead!

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

VB_BookDestroyed.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.VB_BookDestroyed: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom Cam - Tilt Up + RotationNodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh no. No. Why ain't I petrified?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic as you realise the petrification - the thing keeping a deadly disease from spreading across your body - is gone.

Victim_001.speaker: Player
Victim_001.text: You don't sound pleased. Would you rather be a statue?

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I have the Bite. Laduguer's Bite.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You have an incurable disease - admitting it with worry and shame.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: How... how am I still breathin'?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Confused as you look down at your hands and body - feeling fine. You're trying to make sense of everything.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... I could see... a person's fate... horrible.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: I'd the Bite... Laduguer's Bite... sickness worse than... death.

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: Hag turned me... to stone. Stopped the... spread.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: You're on the brink of being defeated in the fight and you've stopped it - preparing to beg for your life with a new deal. You're breathless and in pain, fighting to regain control.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: little breathy from the fight, coldly determined in the second line

HagBegsForMercy.text: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: wincing at the thought in the first line, turning on the charm in the second, trying to regain control

HagBegsForMercy.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy.text: Indeed. I'll take your head and stick it on a pike.
Now, petal, there's... there's no need for such talk.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: Player has threatened to kill you. You're scared and not used to it - trying not to show it.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: You want the girl so bad? Fine. Have her roasted!
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: You've just set the cage holding a pregnant woman prisoner on fire. Middle of a fight. Laugh and a vicious smile.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

ControlledByMask.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

PAD_Explore2.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore2.text: The work of the hag. No doubt about it.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.Victim_001_Dead: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.
session_synopses.HagBegsForMercy: The hag is on the brink of defeated. She's stoppped the fight to try and plead for her life by offering the player the thing she does best - a deal. If Mayrina is present she asks offers you a powerful gift in exchange for her life (she will also take Mayrina with her) or the hag can bargain for Mayrina's life but lose out on the powerful gift. It is a tense and heightened situation.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.ControlledByMask: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore2: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.text: You come to my home, interfere in my business, and now have the gall to face me in the heart of my lair? You petulant bollocks.
Lair.context: NodeContext: This begins the fight. Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

Lair.text: I'll rip your spine out your arsehole.
I'll use your blood to spice my stew.
I'll keep you alive until I've sucked the marrow from your bones.
And then I'll bring you back and do it all over again.

MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext: as if drugged - hushed voice

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.text: Very droll, my friend. Most amusing.
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext:  a deranged but poltie butler

MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

AD_PutOnMask.speaker: Player
AD_PutOnMask.context: NodeContext: Intrigued as you look around

AD_PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. Just relax. Let me in.

AD_WearMask.text: Stop fighting me, petal. Let me take care of you.
AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You are attempting to break into someone's mind and take over from afar. Voice is low and seductive - enticing.

session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.Lair: These are fired at the very beginning of the fight with the hag - tense scene. Hag is at one end of the cavern. Mayrina is trapped in a cage in the middle. Player is on the other side.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Servitude and is brainwashed to serve the hag and her 'visitors'.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.AD_PutOnMask: Player has put on the mask and looks around - relaising they can see things different (it allows them to bypass several illusions and traps within the hag's lair). However, the hag will attempt to break into their mind.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: The tadpole was tampered with? That complicates things...

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: Tampered or not, we need to get these things out of our heads. Let's find another way.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleDivine: This VB plays after attempting to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. She confesses that there's something special about it and she can't remove it.Will play on the player who leaves the dialog that reveals this fact, but characters can be fairly opinionated here since they are reacting to knowledge.Up to two characters.

session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

node_data.speaker: Rozzak
node_data.text: If you're here to help with the raid, talk to her ladyship. She's in charge.
node_data.context: NodeContext: deferential to 'her ladyship'. Dismissive toward us

session_synopses: Impatient goblin. Planning a raid with a drow, and he's deferring to her.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Player
Backup002.text: Sounds like a bloody scrap. Where did you see that?

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: You ain't hear? We sacked Waukeen's Rest and left it to burn.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: Drow flingin' magic, gnolls snappin' off heads. Inn's nothin' but a pile of ash by now.

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

Worg_002.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002.text: Good smell. Pack smell. Smell like papa. Papa?
Worg_002.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the shit on your face. Quick, primal - as if looking for comfort.

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
