session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Worg_002: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I do not have time for interruptions from underlings.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As she turns to you, her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: the drow turns and looks at the player, studying themNodeContext: unnerved

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *One of those the voice spoke of. One of the Chosen. The vision fades away...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
node_data.context: NodeContext: disgusted - speaking to an elf player and has a hatred of them. 'darthiir' (dar-FEAR) is a derogatory term for an elf

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Her heart is more generous than mine. Join my hunt, faerie. And obey me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'faerie' is a derogatory way of referring to the player's race (an elf)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Join you? I'm here to kill you.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: You would dare...? Guards - to me!
node_data.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

session_synopses: The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

Caster_01.speaker: Erna
Caster_01.text: You don't want to go in there. Really.
Caster_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, more serious. The previous warning was an attempt to be friendly, but we're pushing our luck now and the humour's gone.

session_synopses.Caster_01: This mercenary is guarding the entrance to a supply of incredibly rare and explosive material. She's trying to strike a more reasonable tone than the other guard we speak to.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: The ringleaders of these butchers still draw breath. Nobody is safe until we stop them.

Halsin_Following_Elf.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_Following_Elf.text: Hurry, please. Any delay could cost innocents' lives.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Worg_001.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001.text: Smells big. Big belly. Big GUTS.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following_Elf: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his elf form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Worg_001: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transofrmed into a bear.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.
session_synopses.CombatCutscene_Bear: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. The bear attacks the door that flies away and potentially kill a goblin.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |We generally eat people and other animals that end up here|

Spiders_Wildshape.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Spiders_Wildshape.text: |Eated! Eated! Is it eated or eaten, sis?|

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Keep moving, 'less you're wanting a clubbing and drubbing.

Goblin_003.speaker: Tracker Nik-Nuk
Goblin_003.text: Heh. Boss Ragzlin weren't lying when he said anyone could join the Absolute's ranks.

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
session_synopses.Goblin_003: Drunken goblin isn't scared of that famous hero the Blade of Frontiers!

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Player
Friend1.text: Well, it didn't smell as bad as I thought it would - more like lavender.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout the smell. 'S that magic ring 'e wears. Some kinda stupid side effect.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's making a side comment.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: But the foot itself, it looked craggy, didn't it? Rugged? Big? I get excited just thinkin' about it...
Friend1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin shudders, then turns to stare wistfully into space.NodeContext: excited

FistFight.speaker: Crusher
FistFight.text: Wait! I - I yield! I yield!
FistFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is on the floor, speaking up at you. (Custom Scene for Goblin on the floor)NodeContext: Very panicked. They were in a fight he thought he'd win, but he's losing.

session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.
session_synopses.FistFight: We defeated the drunk goblin in a fight he started. He yields before we can kill him. He's lying on the ground.

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: What did you want with that mind flayer?

session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.
session_synopses.Dead: The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *A longing for small spaces, stone walls hugging close. Confining. Comforting.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *There is a light here, in the tight space beneath the floor. Secret things that shine.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.
session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

SpiderNest_CustomCrime.speaker: Narrator
SpiderNest_CustomCrime.text: *The goblins appear rather attached to their prisoners. Best not brutalise any more of them.*

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.SpiderNest_CustomCrime: Unvoiced crime dialogue, spoken by any goblin who witnesses a player attacking or killing a prisoner thrown into the spider pit at the goblin camp
session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

Chapel.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel.text: Smart. All you need to do is open yourself to the Absolute, and I'll do the rest.
Chapel.context: NodeContext: slightly more sinister than her friendlier nodes - we don't know what "the rest" is but it doesn't sound great; in actuality, she's tricking us into imprisonment and possible death

session_synopses.Chapel:
The goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's charismatic and friendly, in a crude sort of way, but has an underlying suspicion and curiosity. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute: Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'.If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolute’s influence.If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box.NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin raises a club, ready to hit the adventurer, but then notices the player and stops.NodeContext: He's torturing an adventurer and getting sadistic pleasure from this.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: You again? Wanna join 'im this time?

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: Why are you still torturing him?

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: Some other git found the grove before we did. Made us look real stupid, 'e did.
Torture.context: NodeContext: a little sour at the memory

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: So now we're makin' sure this lad regrets not tellin' us.
Torture.context: NodeContext: deriving sadistic pleasure from this.

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: I'm watchin' ya. Spike promised that any meat that falls off is mine.
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's standing a few paces away from the prisoner.NodeContext: Mean.

session_synopses.Torture: One of the goblins is torturing a prisoner, either to find out where the grove is, or just because he wants to. The player can try to get rid of him - if Shadowheart is present, she gives some advice on how to do so. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has unique options criticising the goblin's techniques.
session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well, lookie here. Seems like you know your way around the course.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: Reassessing you - you've just proven yourself to be quite good at the game and she's patronising you

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: Your rules didn't say anything about fire.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well who ever heard o' chicken chase without fire? We're not bloody amateurs.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if you're just being stupid now. Scornful - you can't play chicken chase without fire, keep up.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: That's the spirit! Now show me the coin.
Commentator.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking the bet because jumping to the betting nodes which can be shown to the players during the game alsoNodeContext: Loud, encouraging - but more eager to see your money.

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: On second thought, I'm done playing.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *The chicken's head bobs, eyes darting around at the leering goblin faces. She's terrified.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Appealing directly to the player for help. Hoping anyone will save her.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *She meets your eye, and the fear there hardens into rage. She gathers herself.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Desperately angry and afraid - but determind to attack the goblins and peck their eyes out.

session_synopses.Commentator: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.
session_synopses.Ball: This chicken is being used as the 'ball' in a goblin sport. The goblins chase it around an enclosure, trying to make it run between two posts so that they can score a 'goal'. It's exhausted and frightened.

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Quite the trove. How'd you get your hands on all this?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Nicked 'em off the dead, didn't I?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Erh, I mean - raid spoils, your majesticality.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, bowingNodeContext: Regretting his choice of words

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: A warning, whelp. Do not threaten me.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Whatcha gonna do about it? Run off and cry to yer spider-mum?
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: talking to a drow - 'spider-mum' refers to the drow goddess Lolth. This is a deeply dangerous and blasphemous thing to say, but he's too immature and cocky to realise he could be getting himself into serious trouble. Doesn't know boundaries.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: No. I'm going to cut out your tongue.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: 'Avin' a drink? 'S all the sweeter when it's free, innit?
Goblin002.context: NodeContext: Nastily amused, referencing the fact that they burned an inn down to get the drink. Treating you like you're in on the joke.

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.context: NodeContext: Pointing out that even if the alcohol was free, it's still weird foreign stuff.

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: That inn was askin' for a burnin', sellin' this muck. Ain't even chewy.
Goblin002.context: NodeContext: Shaking her head, rueful. Attitude is 'would you believe it? It isn't even chewy!'

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Player
Goblin005.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Goblin002: This goblin is a chatty one, enjoying the party and making pleasant conversation. She assumes you're here for the same reasons she is - enjoying the spoils of a recent brutal raid.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Wanderer: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.text: |I still have info to exctract from prisoner. Don't do anything funny!|

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.text: NO! He was MINE! Mine to kill!

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.text: I'll cut you for this. Cut you to pieces and mix all your meat. And then I will FEAST.

session_synopses.Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom: Grush gets mad at the player for attacking or killing the tortured adventurer.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why would I let anyone scar me for life?

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't just a mark on the flesh: it's magic. Only them what follows the Absolute can see it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: as if trying to explain something obvious to an idiot

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Let's us know you're on our side. That way, nobody'll mess with ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining something simple, talking down to us a little

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do the goblins want smokepowder for?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Ask the drow they're all bowing to. That glint in her eye is bad news for someone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shrug - it's not her problem, but she pities whoever the drow is planning to deal with.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Not my concern, so long as I'm paid. Speaking of - something to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, getting back to the matter at hand. She's used to minding her own business - and everything is just business to her.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

node_data.speaker: Abdirak
node_data.text: Well met, dear child. Would you enjoy some hands-on worship of Loviatar, Maiden of Pain?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has met Abdirak but not done the penance. Voice low and inviting and familiar.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm ready.

node_data.speaker: Abdirak
node_data.text: Oh, I have something exquisite in mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to the beating/penance. Excited. Sexually charged. Already imaging the pain he is about to inflict.

node_data.speaker: Abdirak
node_data.text: But wait - you are hurt. Please tend to your wounds before we begin your penance.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has agreed to do penance but their health is too low. The priest is warning that they must heal first. Genuine and sincere, he doesn't want to hurt them.

node_data.speaker: Abdirak
node_data.text: I prefer a fresh canvas.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A smile as he says this - vaguely sexual overtones.

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.
session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Open your peepers, freak. It's time.
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: player waking up - blinking, seeing priestess standing right before them, leaning in closeNodeContext: speaking to player who is captive, in chains - they've been resting and she's waking them

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: You should be sprouting tentacles by now, but you're still the same kind of ugly you always was.

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Disappointing not to have my own squiddie... but your giblets'll make for a tasty supper.
CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: Sorry - I may have left that a little late. No lasting damage, I hope?
Warlock.context: NodeContext: brushing herself down after killing a goblin priestess - apologetic, amused. speaking to a chained player she just rescued

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: My master has been keeping a close eye on you. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

session_synopses.Warlock:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations.Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess.

The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Hold up your hands to show you mean no harm.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: What career could possibly involve getting locked up by goblins?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
session_synopses.Volo_InCage: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: The druid Halsin is in here somewhere.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: Let's hope we find him in one piece.

session_synopses.PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp: Thematically, this VB is a conversation about the goblin camp and how difficult it might be to find the druid there. Player will be aware that he's being held captive somewhere in the camp and can see the goblins's strength.This occurs over walking into a trigger, so lines between speaker 1 and speaker 2 can be fairly opinionated.

AD_Goblin_001_Combat.speaker: Warrior Sul
AD_Goblin_001_Combat.text: Bet them guts are nice and juicy!

HalsinDiedBearform.speaker: Narrator
HalsinDiedBearform.text: *The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*

session_synopses.HalsinDiedBearform: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_03: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: How you doing, pal? Looking for some odds and ends? I've scavenged all sorts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly, like a cheeky bloke at a market selling stolen goods

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are the rest of the goblins?

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: On their way to Moonrise, with her ladyship. They left me here to make sure we ain't left nothing valuable behind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

session_synopses.WolfPens_AD_WorgOutsideCage: AD which is played when the worgs are outside the cage

AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.text: Come now, Mayrina! Time to go.
AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.context: InternalNodeContext: Leaving with Mayrina, i.e. outside of combat.
InternalNodeContext: Mayrina & hag leave together, Hag is not in combatNodeContext: Mocking tone and wave as you taunt the player.

session_synopses.AD_TeleportSurrogateMother: Fires as the hag grabs Mayrina and teleports to the lair OR Hag is injured and disappears from the fight alone.

AD_HagDisappear.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

Brother_001_AD_Fallback.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: Looking around, scared but trying not to show it.

ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Player has just saved Ethel. This is exactly what she hoped would happen. Still playing up the old lady act -upset and frazzled and overcome with emotion.

ThankPlayer.text: I - I didn't mean for this to happen.

ThankPlayer.speaker: Player
ThankPlayer.text: Do you know this 'Mayrina' they mentioned?
She's their little sister. And... she's staying with me.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: You've just admitted that two men have died because you lied. You're acting like heartbroken and upset, when this was always your plan

ThankPlayer.text: This is all my fault. But I made a promise!
Mayrina begged me not to breathe a word if they came looking for her. And my word is my bond.
ThankPlayer.context: NodeContext: Seems genuinely upset - pleasing for understanding.

ThankPlayer.text: That poor thing will be distraught. We can't let her know - it'd break her poor heart.
I'd best get going, but please stop by my house. I'd like to thank you proper.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.AD_HagDisappear: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.ThankPlayer:
This dialogue occurs if the player has sided with the hag in the ambush and saved her - by killing the brothers.
She's still in old lady mode, hamming up how upset she is, but there should be a hint on the last set of questions, about the gold, that this was an act and that there is more to her than meets the eye.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A fetid smell assaults your nostrils. Dead flesh lies below - a great deal of it.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: The well is disgusting and well

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fresh, sweet-smelling water gurgles gently below.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Soft and idyllic description of the well

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Drink from the well.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The warm rush of power flows through you. You feel stronger, faster - better.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Occurs after drinking from the well

session_synopses: This well sits just outside of the hag's teahouse. When the player drinks from it, they feel a rush of power and gain a positive status (regardless of whether the illusion is up or down). However, once they enter combat with the hag, it turns to poison in their veins.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Ah, a fellow wanderer. Forgive the aroma.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly - noticing a stranger, wryly apologising for the slight stench

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Powdered iron-vine. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining the smell in the air - he's taken a foul substance designed to ward off monsters

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: An old hunter's trick - if you can't mask your scent, spoil it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Friendly, unassuming, as if what he's saying is perfectly conventional

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Whatever you're hunting, your stench alone will kill it.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Hah! A quick wit is rare indeed. Good manners, however, all beings can aspire to.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We've just insulted him and he's absolutely unfazed. Second line is simply polite advice.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: I suggest you find yours before dealing with the lady of this house.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Advising with only a slight hint of admonishment

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A sharp wit will serve you better, if you're to bargain with the lady of this house.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: That is why you come to her lair, I take it? To bargain?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Gently prodding for our story

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: 'The lady of this house'?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: A more innocent name than some I could call her. But it is what she is that ought to concern you.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Her kind have hidden among us since the first darkness - and their knowledge is matched only by their spite.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing slightly grave - telling us of a great evil thing that is not to be underestimated

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Know how to ask, and they'll share that knowledge. If you're fool enough to pay their price.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Telling us the risk might be worth the reward - but is is a great risk

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I think you're mistaken - this place looks innocent enough.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: That would be nice. I'd welcome a proper cup of tea.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But I'm not wrong. Take her lightly, and she'll serve up your eyes for appetisers.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: I'll eat them, too. I need her knowledge - the thing I hunt has gone to ground.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Only faintly apologetic - he wishes us no harm, but he needs the hag and her information

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But she thrives on suffering. Once she hears what awaits my quarry when I catch him, she will help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Growing grave

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any advice on how to deal with her?

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: Scream. Turn. Run the other way - that's what I'd like to say.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: But bad as she is, I'm betting whatever drove you to her door is worse.

node_data.speaker: Gandrel
node_data.text: So instead: know you're outmatched. Know what you're willing to give. And mind your manners.

session_synopses: Male, middle-age or older.Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion). A younger General Iroh from Avatar is a good reference - someone who makes you feel good about yourself just by conversing with you.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: Light wanes only to wax again - and though life fades, memory shall not.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Player has said a prayer that has made you feel much better. Sincere thanks as you hold back tears.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.text: Quick. Get out of here. She won't like me talking to you.
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting down in her chair - looking at her foodNodeContext: Afraid - looking around for the hag. Head low.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: You've a face on you that could turn milk, petal.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: A walk would cheer me up.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: You ask this tentatively. You're desperate to go outside but don't want to upset Ethel.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: Hush, now! Won't be discussing that again.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: Smile as you dismiss the girl's request to leave. Cheery.

AD_HusbandGrave.speaker: Player
AD_HusbandGrave.text: 'Here lies Connor - beloved husband, and a tasty little morsel to boot.'
AD_HusbandGrave.context: NodeContext: Above a gravestone - a cruel jab.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: I dragged my husband here in a wheelbarrow. Buried him. Took everything the hag threw at  me for him.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: And some godsdamned psychopath digs him up? I hate this place. I hate everyone.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: Not quite the outcome intended, but I must say - the technique was excellent.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: The spell is cast - what's done is done.

session_synopses.ResurrectHusband: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.
session_synopses.AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene: This fires between Mayrina and the Hag in the teahouse before the player has spoken to either of them.
session_synopses.AD_HusbandGrave: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterResurrection: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *A diminutive creature sporting a red hat glares at you.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *You recognise the redcap - a fey creature known for its bloodlust.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Redcap Blood Sage, Redcap, Redcap Blood Sage, 0446e7c4-3076-415c-aa7f-deb7f43e5d06, Redcap, a72e6051-d06b-469c-b6dc-4c962cfe307f
IllusionRedcap.context: CinematicNodeContext: The redcap doesn't know his illusion has failed - glaring in rage at the playerNodeContext: You don't know your illusion has failed - as far as you know, you're still a sheep. Consider making this 'sheep noise' beneath you - animalistic and rage filled as you hiss out a 'Baaa'

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *That noise. Is the creature pretending to be a... sheep?*

session_synopses.IllusionRedcap:
This occurs in the swamp. Sheep wander the area - except they're redcaps (a type of violent faerie) hidden by the hag's illusions. The creatures are pretending to be sheep. 
The illusion can be shattered by an animal handling check. OR if the player preciously succeeded in a perception check in the area.

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Someone cut these men to pieces. I doubt they had time to scream.
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.context: InternalNodeContext: No idea who brothers are

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

Victim_001_AD_Dying.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_AD_Dying.text: The Bite! No. I don't want to die. I don't - Argh.
Victim_001_AD_Dying.context: NodeContext: You're about to puke your guts up and die a horrible death. You feel it coming - you're panicked, scared and terrified.

session_synopses.Victim_001_AD_Dying: Edgecase for if you don't speak to the victim and he has to die. You're about to puke your guts up after being de-petrified

session_synopses.Dead: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If killed, she can be interrogated about what she was looking for - in this case, the missing Duke Ravengard.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.text: An unlikely place for such a fortunate find.

Sign_PAD.speaker: Player
Sign_PAD.text:
'Welcome to Waukeen's Rest.
West - Baldur's Gate. East - Elturel.'
Sign_PAD.context: NodeContext: The player is reading from a signpost. Pronunciation: Wah-KEEN, ELL-tur-ELL

VB_House.speaker: Player
VB_House.text: I hear shouting. Someone needs help.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow: Party with drow in it comes upon a dead drow and comments on the armour. The second speaker is always a Dr
session_synopses.Sign_PAD: The player is reading from a signpost in front of the tavern 'Waukeen's Rest'.
session_synopses.VB_House: PC approaches tavern where Flaming Fists are trying to break through.
session_synopses.OxAlive_AD: An ox caught in a stall near a burning inn. He is agitated, a dead goblin at  his feet. This AD plays if the player gets near but dialogue cannot be initiated (say, if they're polymorphed.)
session_synopses.DeadDrow1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the drow raiders. He was killed by a Flaming Fist archer perched atop the inn.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Oh. Holy, good holy. We follow Yeenoghu holy.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: He makes us hungry. Always hungry.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *She is still ravenous, her mind a hungry pit. The flesh of her pack wasn't enough to satisfy her.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: 'she' is a monstrous gnoll - it is hungry for the player's flesh. Anxiety in the player's voice

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Dominate her mind, commanding her to feast on herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *Her tadpole responds, thrashing violently, and the fragile tissue of her brain tears and splits.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: triumphant but disgusted - witnessing a horrifying injury that we caused to an enemy through psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *You taste the blood in her throat, feel it pooling in the cavity of her skull. But she still resists.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: growing anxiety - feeling resistance of a wounded enemy through a psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Harness your willpower, and order her to devour herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *Your tadpole wriggles, contented, as she tears out her own throat.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: watching a beast - the flind - preparing to devour itself. We commanded her to do this, but it's still horrifying

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.Flind:
The flind is the leader of a pack of gnolls. Normally, these monsters hunger for flesh and eat anything, but the flind has been infected with a mind flayer's tadpole (like the players) and this has created an internal 'Voice' that guides it toward certain meat, forbidding others. The forbidden meats are those that work for the mind flayers - including the players - leading to a telepathic 'dialogue' when the flind restrains itself from attacking and calls off its pack.

We can attempt to overpower the Flind psionically, allowing us to control it temporarily in order to destroy the pack of gnolls. If we choose to fight the Flind, we should be prepared for a difficult encounter. It is strong, though far from the most powerful of its kind thanks to the war raging in its brain.
session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01_AD_Angry: Gnoll cackles madly after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.GnollRanger02_AD: A gnoll standing near a cave entrance with the rest of its pack. Idle SFX as it growls, barks etc
session_synopses.GnollRanger01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting speak with dead on a corpse that fell from a platform above

Dead.speaker: Dead Toll Collector
Dead.context: NodeContext: a speaking corpse telling us its name and job

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue with tollhouse worker, initiated when talking to corpse that has fallen down cliffside outside tollhouse. There is a key near the corpse that can be found through perception check or in this dialogue.

session_synopses.AD_Occupied: A Flaming Fist searching a burning building for survivors. This AD is triggered when the player tries to interact with them, but they are unavailable for dialogue.

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: Are we really going to hunt a devil on their behalf?

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.

session_synopses.PAD_RefugeesAreCultists: Reflection dialog that plays after discovering that the paladins hunting Karlach made a deal with the arch-devil Zariel. The party reflects on whether these people deserve to be punished for dealing with a devil, or whether we should help them.Speaker 1 has agreed to help them. Speaker 2 comments on th is decision. Karlach cannot take part in this dialog.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

VB_WreckedCaravan.speaker: Player
VB_WreckedCaravan.text: This must be where the gnolls attacked.

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: There's nothing in there that'll help - leave it!
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Quiet conversation(?) - the afraid of the gnolls and don't want to provoke them

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: If we don't deal with them gnolls, none of us are getting out of here alive.
Agent_001_Cave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Showing the gnolls at the entrance of the cave.NodeContext: Urgency, panic

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave.text: One of us is getting out of here richer - I don't fight for free.
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Could make a non-persuasion node (auto-success)

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Fine. Money's useless to dead men.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: Offering to pay for our help. Abrupt - wants to get this out of the way

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Damn it... must have dropped my purse.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: patting down his pockets, confused

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Get us out of this, and I swear we'll make it worth your while.

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.text: I'm out of flasks! They're coming!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.context: NodeContext: terrified, shouting desperately during a battle - the 'flask' are like flammable grenades he was using to hold back monsters, and now he's run out they're coming for him

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Someone must have found the wagon by now.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, doesn't really believe this

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Only if whoever found the wagon is stupid enough to fight a pack of gnolls.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: preparing to let someone down

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: So, no. I think help's a long way from here.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, speaking a harsh truth

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character is tied to chair.NodeContext: badly beaten, eyes closed, barely conscious, expecting to be killed

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.text: ... you beautiful bastard... thought my luck had finally run out...
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: either slumping in chair (no longer tied) or falling to knees, rubbing his wrists where he was boundNodeContext: exhausted and badly beaten - we just untied him from a chair where he was being tortured. Grateful and relieved but almost passing out from the pain

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.VB_WreckedCaravan: The party character comments on the wrecked caravan. The player might already know about the special chest from the Den Zhent Agents
session_synopses.Agent_001_Cave: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_001_TiedUp: In situations where Rugan survives after being beaten and tortured by the Zhentarim, players can interact with him in the chair he's tied to. He's exhausted, badly beaten, and barely capable of speaking full sentences.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: Go away. Or you will become new flesh.

Healthy_01.speaker: Hyena
Healthy_01.text: I will make you new flesh.

Healthy_01.speaker: Player
Healthy_01.text: I don't take orders from beasts.

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *The beautiful broken heap smells oddly enticing. You find you can't resist inhaling her offals.*
DeathEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *You hear what comes next before you see it: the sharp snapping of bones and a yelp of pain as her body starts to twist and undulate.*

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *You watch with cold realisation - this isn't the end of one life, but the start of another...*

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *...Gnolls - vicious, monstrous humanoids - can spawn from the corpses of dying hyenas.*

DeathEvent.speaker: Player
DeathEvent.text: Show mercy, ending her life swiftly.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: I'd prefer not to see it again, that's for sure.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: Best to move before the blood draws more of them.

03.speaker: Narrator
03.text: *You might almost pity the creature. Too full to move, yet desperately starving.*

session_synopses.Healthy_01: A hyena in the plains is displeased when the player is close, wanting to devour them to please Yeenoghu.
session_synopses.DeathEvent: The player encounters a dying hyena that is about to turn into a gnoll. If they discover this in time, they can try to stop the gnoll from being born. Otherwise, the gnoll is born and attacks the player when the dialogue ends.
session_synopses.VB_PostFight_3P: Three players have just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas.
session_synopses.03: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.
session_synopses.SickHyena_AD_Groaning: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis
node_data.text: Stop gawking and look for a way inside!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, facing the playerInternalNodeContext: Desire is trapped behind rubble.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Dousing.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
Dousing.text: We'll never put this fire out. You're better off helping anyone trapped inside!
Dousing.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Tryign to put out the fire using a bucket

session_synopses.Dousing: A Flaming Fist trying  to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. He's inexperienced and terrified of fire, so he's panicking.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts.
